alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Blanco; Burnet; Edwards; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Llano; Medina; Real; Uvalde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 1:08AM CST until January 15 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Periods of wind chill values between zero and ten degrees. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation expected. Total ice accumulations up to five hundredths of an inch. Little to no sleet or snow accumulation expected. * WHERE...Much of south central Texas. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST Monday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, through 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, especially bridges and overpasses. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the morning commute. Bitterly cold wind chills creating dangerous conditions on exposed skin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lowest wind chills are expected Tuesday morning. Portions of the Hill Country may see the wind chills dip below zero degrees, and may need the issuance of a Wind Chill Warning.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state can be obtained at drivetexas.org.

area.areaDesc: Bandera; Blanco; Burnet; Edwards; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Llano; Medina; Real; Uvalde
